text:
Only 5.4% of all 21M
#Bitcoin
remain to be mined.

In 2028, there will only be 3.125% left.

Meanwhile, ~0.1% of the world has adopted Bitcoin as a primary savings technology / treasury asset.

99.9% of the world will fight over what's left.  

Are you positioned accordingly?

text:
It was a volatile week for
@smarterwebuk
stock.  Alongside this,
#SWC
$TSWCF
announced its biggest
#Bitcoin
buy, the biggest fundraise, and had many positive meetings.  I thought it might be helpful to share a few analytics that I have been looking at.  

Here is a view of the company‚Äôs market cap alongside the company‚Äôs treasury assets (cash + Bitcoin) over time.  You‚Äôll notice that while one had a volatile week, the other continued on its trajectory.  (Note: numbers in GBP as of Friday close-of-market in the UK; treasury figures do not yet include any proceeds from the ATM-style instrument.)

If you divide these two metrics, the result is the mNAV for the SWC treasury.  As you can see, it has compressed considerably.

It may be of interest to compare this mNAV against other companies pursuing a Bitcoin treasury strategy.  One particularly interesting comparison is Metaplanet a year ago, when its BTC treasury was a similar size to SWC‚Äôs today.

In July 2024, Metaplanet had ~300 BTC and an mNAV of ~20, at which point that premium compressed rapidly down to ~6 within a month.  The share price fell from 300 yen to 64 yen, a 79% decline.  One interesting result of that time period was that the Metaplanet community embraced the phrase ‚Äúvolatility is vitality‚Äù in recognition that high vol is part of successfully executing this kind of Bitcoin strategy.

I shared this in the SWC community group yesterday (check it out for SWC discussions and analysis like this
x.com/i/communities/19156736‚Ä¶
).  Thought others not in the group might be interested to see this post as well!

engagement.note: These figures were correct as of January 27, 2026, 12:00 PM London time

text:
It was a volatile week for
@smarterwebuk
stock. Alongside this,
#SWC
$TSWCF
announced its biggest Bitcoin buy, the biggest fundraise, and had many positive meetings.  I thought it might be helpful to share a few analytics that I have been looking at.

Here is a view of the company‚Äôs market cap alongside the company‚Äôs treasury assets (cash + Bitcoin) over time.  You‚Äôll notice that while one had a volatile week, the other continued on its trajectory.  (Note: numbers in GBP as of Friday close-of-market in the UK; treasury figures do not yet include any proceeds from the ATM-style instrument.)

If you divide these two metrics, the result is the mNAV for the SWC treasury.  As you can see, it has compressed considerably.

It may be of interest to compare this mNAV against other companies pursuing a Bitcoin treasury strategy.  One particularly interesting comparison is Metaplanet a year ago, when its BTC treasury was a similar size to SWC‚Äôs today.

In July 2024, Metaplanet had ~300 BTC and an mNAV of ~20, at which point that premium compressed rapidly down to ~6 within a month.  The share price fell from 300 yen to 64 yen, a 79% decline.  One interesting result of that time period was that the Metaplanet community embraced the phrase ‚Äúvolatility is vitality‚Äù in recognition that high vol is part of successfully executing this kind of Bitcoin strategy.

I hope you enjoy your weekends.

text:
I think this chart speaks to how efficient
@asjwebley
has been and the relentless pace with which he has been executing the Bitcoin treasury strategy.

Remarkable fundraising execution in such a short amount of time.

Now with ¬£41.2m of cash on hand...
x.com/BitcoinBee21/status/19‚Ä¶

[Quoted post by @BitcoinBee21: There's a lot of comparisons between swc and coin floating around but I think this is the most important one. It tracks how much money has been raised via wraps, bookbuilds, placings etc from the first time the company raised funds to buy bitcoin.

I think this chart is important as this game isn't really about how much bitcoin you buy but about how much money you can raise. You can't buy bitcoin if you don't have the cash.

One to keep track of. Coin need a raise of about ¬£18m to catch up.]

text:
Hello SWC community!

Thank you for the very kind welcome - I'm flattered and grateful.  I'm excited to help contribute to this remarkable story that
@asjwebley
has brought to life.

I look forward to engaging with you all here.  For my first post, I felt a meme was in order... granted, a rather nerdy meme I made today. 

My favorite painting ever is a British classic that stopped me in my tracks at the National Portrait Gallery.  

As you most likely already know, this painting is an allegory of the Industrial Revolution.  Technological progress rendered the tried-and-true methods of the past obsolete.  

True of warships then.  True of hard money now.  

In my opinion, the sun is setting on the dominance of analog SoV assets like gold.  Meanwhile, the sun rises on the era of digital capital.

Many will mourn the fading of the old, as Turner did.  But a few will embrace the new for its merits, ushering in a bright orange future.  

It's often hard to find that latter group.  But here you are.
